item.title: By: name
item.dc:creator: name
item.description: they run / feign death till the bosses, and solo where needed.
item.content:encoded: they run / feign death till the bosses, and solo where needed.

item.title: By: Foton
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description:
So it's a profit scheme, eh?
Those hunter bastards.
item.content:encoded:
So it’s a profit scheme, eh?

Those hunter bastards.

item.title: By: Moleman
item.dc:creator: Moleman
item.description:
My guess, with absolutely no information?
Farming the bosses for disenchant loot.
A high level hunter can take on some pretty nasty baddies, one on one- and Mauradon has just that, in areas that a smart hunter could easily get to with the proper use of feign death- the Mauradon patrols aren't too bad, and the static groups all have a bit of space between them.
If I remember correctly, all the bosses in that second section (Landslide, Princess, the Croc, and some named goblin) are single enemy fights- if you've done the hunter epic quest, you've sucessfully fought level 60 elites with no assistance, so that shouldn't be a problem. Any of the blue loot disenchants into small brilliant shards, with some cash besides. Check the auction house- if those guys have large lots of small brilliant shards for sale, they likely got them while this was going on.
item.content:encoded:
My guess, with absolutely no information?

Farming the bosses for disenchant loot.

A high level hunter can take on some pretty nasty baddies, one on one- and Mauradon has just that, in areas that a smart hunter could easily get to with the proper use of feign death- the Mauradon patrols aren’t too bad, and the static groups all have a bit of space between them.

If I remember correctly, all the bosses in that second section (Landslide, Princess, the Croc, and some named goblin) are single enemy fights- if you’ve done the hunter epic quest, you’ve sucessfully fought level 60 elites with no assistance, so that shouldn’t be a problem. Any of the blue loot disenchants into small brilliant shards, with some cash besides. Check the auction house- if those guys have large lots of small brilliant shards for sale, they likely got them while this was going on.
